The commonplace Kitkat is well-known in the United States...
...as a chocolate-covered wafer you can find at any convenience store.
In Japan, it's a whole different beast though.
Gourmet versions of the sweet treats are a huge craze there,...
...with some bizarre flavors like wasabi and lemon vinegar.
Pumpkin and green tea are also popular flavors.
Kitkat's success in Japan may have to do with a lucky language connection.
...so the cookies have a highly positive connotation.
